Hi everyone! I am a complete newbie and I am looking for some leading or advice, on where to start. I have experience with html, css and js. Recently as a frontend beginner, I found a job, they already have their content existing. Now I try to get familiar with HubSpot and Hubl as a language to write. Do you have any suggestions on how to start? Or where to find examples I can work with?

I already am watching some tutorials and reading content from HS web. That's how I also found this forum.

Thank you for all your answers!
Hi Lucia! If you're just starting out with HubSpot, I'd definitely recommend getting CMS certified with the <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-developers|CMS for Developers> course.

From there, you could also check out:
• <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/introduction-to-HubSpot-apis|Introduction to the HubSpot APIs>, if you want to work with the APIs
• <https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLTGNq2fWP3b04KgIHQ9f2UCxDm8Bu9Jht|Getting Started With HubSpot CMS Hub for WordPress Developers> is another great intro to building on the CMS, even if you're not coming from Wordpress
• <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-best-practices-for-developers|HubSpot CMS Best Practices for Developers> is good to learn about general web best practices, like accessibility and performance, and more details on HubSpot CMS Development

Also check out the <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/tree/main/src|CMS boilerplate on github> (<https://boilerplate.HubSpotcms.com/|link to sample website>) if looking for code samples or a good starting point for theme development: modules, templates, sections, etc

Hi Ben! Thanks for your response. I am already watching videos and all, but still, the language seems confusing with the relation to HTML. I would like to ask, is there any "library" of the language, from where I can try to write and see how it behaves? Get to know better the syntax itself?

I can pay or whatever, I just need to learn it for a new job.

Hm, yea, I would definitely recommend reviewing the boilerplate code. The main building blocks of CMS Development are:
• Templates
• Sections
• Modules
So I would review the examples in the boilerplate for those.
And then definitely <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-developers|CMS for Developers>, which covers all the basic elements of the CMS like HubL, templates, and modules.
Ok great Ben, you've been a big help in my learning drama today!
HubL is a server-side language like PHP, so you just sort of mix it in with your HTML and CSS - HTML + HubL and CSS + HubL are two template types you can create in the design manager.

The boilerplate uses the <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/src/templates/layouts/base.html|base.html> file as the base template for all templates. You can also see how it uses the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#require-css|require_css> function in the head and the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#require-js|require_js> function in the body to load CSS and JavaScript.

The templates themselves (like <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/src/templates/home.html|home.html>) extend the base template using <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/html-hubl-templates#blocks-and-extends|blocks and extends>. Templates then contain "smaller" pieces like <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/tree/main/src/sections|sections> and <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/tree/main/src/modules|modules>, and also <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags/dnd-areas|drag-and-drop-areas> which work with the drag-and-drop editor.

The hierarchy is sort of like this:

Theme > Templates (base.html and the rest of the templates) > Sections > Modules
Thank you so much! I will try to go through your answers, links, and all suggestions.
